message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper presents a non-probabilistic formulation of topic models for discovering latent representations of large collections of data. This formulation allows for direct control of sparsity and seamless integration with a convex error function for supervised learning. These characteristics suggest that the paper could be relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and computer vision (cs.CV).
